AssociateTargetGroups.title: Binding layer-7 forwarding rules to target groups

AutoRewrite.document: `lbl-lmeeyb1q` is an HTTPS:443 listener. `www.abc.com` is a domain name of a forwarding rule under this listener.
AutoRewrite.title: Automatically generating a redirection relationship

BatchModifyTargetWeight.document: This example shows you how to modify the weight of the real server `ins-19404pl5` (port 110) bound to the forwarding rule `loc-o8cnyw6c` under the listener `lbl-4b5hnc9a` in the CLB instance `lb-dx98lwo0` to 50, and modify the weight of the real server `ins-19411tzv` (port 80) bound to the forwarding rule `loc-8c5pdrb8` under the listener `lbl-20jjtaaw` to 30.
BatchModifyTargetWeight.title: Modifying real server weights in batches

BatchModifyTargetWeight.document: This example shows you how to modify the weights of servers for the layer-4 and layer-7 listeners under a CLB instance at the same time.
BatchModifyTargetWeight.title: Batch modifying the weights of servers bound to layer-4 and layer-7 listeners

CreateListener.document: This example shows you how to create two TCP listeners `lis0` and `lis1` to listen on ports 7569 and 7570 respectively.
CreateListener.title: Creating two TCP listeners lis0 and lis1 to listen on ports 7569 and 7570 respectively

CreateListener.document: This example shows you how to create two TCP listeners which are named `lis0` and `lis1` and used to listen on ports 7569 and 7570, respectively.
CreateListener.title: Creating UDP listener with the default Ping health check

DescribeTaskStatus.document: This example shows you how to query whether an async task is successfully executed if the call to the forwarding rule creating API is returned successfully and the returned `RequestId` is `55c85074-3e7f-4c6d-864f-673660d4f8de`. The `Status` value of 0 in the response indicates that the task succeeded.
DescribeTaskStatus.title: Querying the status of an async task

ModifyBlockIPList.document: This example shows you how to use the blocklist feature. You need to set the header first by specifying the header field of real client IPs to enable the blocklist feature.
ModifyBlockIPList.title: Setting header to enable blocklist feature

ModifyBlockIPList.document: This example shows you how to block IPs. You need to specify the header field of real client IPs to enable the blocklist feature first, and then you can block IPs. You can delete IPs from the blocklist or clear the blocklist in a similar way.
ModifyBlockIPList.title: Adding blocklist

ModifyRule.title: Modifying the health check parameter and forwarding policy of a forwarding rule

ModifyTargetPort.document: This example shows you how to change the port of the CVM instance `ins-dm4xtz0i` bound to the listener `lbl-d1ubsydq` from 233 to 334.
ModifyTargetPort.title: Modifying the port of a bound real server

ModifyTargetWeight.document: This example shows you how to change the weight of the real server `ins-dm4xtz0i` (bound port: 334) bound to the listener `lbl-d1ubsydq` to 8.
ModifyTargetWeight.title: Modifying the weight of the real server bound to a layer-4 listener

ReplaceCertForLoadBalancers.document: This example shows you how to replace a server certificate by specifying a new certificate ID.

SetLoadBalancerClsLog.document: This example shows you how to add or modify the CLS topic of a CLB instance.
SetLoadBalancerClsLog.title: Setting CLS topic

SetLoadBalancerClsLog.document: This example shows you how to delete the CLS topic of a CLB instance.

SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.document: A CLB instance was not previously bound to any security group. This example shows you how to bind the security groups `sg-0936o7sd` and `sg-12345678` to this instance.
SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.title: Binding multiple security groups to a CLB instance

SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.document: A CLB instance was previously bound to two security groups: `sg-0936o7sd` and `sg-12345678`. This example shows you how to unbind the security group `sg-12345678` from this instance.
SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.title: Unbinding a security group from a CLB instance

SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.document: A CLB instance was previously bound to multiple security groups. This example shows you how to unbind all security groups from this instance.
SetLoadBalancerSecurityGroups.title: Unbinding all security groups

SetSecurityGroupForLoadbalancers.title: Binding a security group to multiple CLB instances
